text: Pours nice and thick with a beautiful bright head. Citrus hops on the nose. Flavor of the citra hops helps balance the galaxy in an awesome way!

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Well, NYC, USA. Balanced, refreshing bu simple. Citra x 2 really can be detected.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. HFD #16 Podobny profil do Tree House. Smooth, bardzo dużo owoców, świetny profil goryczki.

Poured from a growler into a tulip: Pours hazy orange with a one finger foamy white head. Aroma is a straight citrus pale ale, lots of grapefruit and orange. Taste is more of the same, so much flavor not a hint of booze. Medium body, perfect carbonation, slight sticky. Really awesome.
On tap at the brewery. Pungent grapefruit and sweet citrus aromas and flavors, before it all finishes quickly and dry. This is outrageously well-made and delicious.

750ml growler purchased on site, drank fresh. Pours a beautiful golden orange, super hazy like a thick juice bomb. Nice foamy, slightly carbonated white head leaving thick lacing. Smells of straight citra hops, smooth citrus, grapefruit bomb and sweet floral hops. Lovely. Tastes delicious. Super well balanced hops, floral, citrus, grapefruit, small, small malts. Nice hoppy bitterness that you look for in a DIPA. The blend of citra and galaxy hops is beautiful in this one. Full mouthfeel leaving a wonderful aftertaste. Another successful SS from Hill Farmstead. Shaun Hills consistency is unparalleled.
On tap at Big Fattys. Pours hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is big tropical fruit and fresh citrus. Flavor is fresh pineapple with citrus and a grapefruit finish. Amazing!

Tap. Doc Ponds, Stowe, VT. Very hazy, orange gold. Thick, dense, super sticky, lasting, white head. Nose has freshly squeezed, pulpy, orange and lime. Some sappy pine. Vanilla sweet malts. Clean and bright. Taste is crisp, pithy, orange oil bitter. Trace of chewy sweetness. Mouthfeel is ridiculously juicy. No trace of the ABV. The juicy oiliness stays the course. Scary easy drinking.
Pours a hazy bright orange with white head. A string grapefruit, floral and hop aroma. A strong citrus hop bomb, floral and pine taste. A lingering sweet citrus and mild bitter hoo aftertaste.

Backlog. CBC Green Session 2016. Hazy, juicy, bright yellow with white head. Dank aroma with grain, citrus, lemon zest and a bit of pine. Similar taste with loads of orange, pine, peach and a bit of dankness. Exceptionally well balanced. Dry, crisp, heavily bitter end.

Complex imperial India pale ale with many subtle notes consistent with the style of many hill farmstead brews.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A very nice citrusy IPA. Pours a bright cloudy orange with a white head. Smells of citrus, lemon and grapefruit. Taste is bright, with lots of citrus upfront, followed by grapefruit, lemon and a bit of herbs. Had on tap at Mad Taco in Vermont.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From tap at Warpigs. Hazy orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, citrus, peach, pine, grapefruit and bitterness.

on tap poured into a tulip..golden orange with a fluffy white head..aroma of mango
,pineapple,orange peel,apricots..tastes like it smells with some cracker malt and
biscuits..well done.

Rating #2400! Thanks to Corbet for this beauty. The pour is a turbid light yellow orange with a thick cap of white head that falls down to a film, leaving good lace. The aroma is awesome. The citrus are fantastic. Huge and juicy with a nice Galaxy hop presence. This is a thing of beauty. Fuck. The flavor is also juicy as fuck. Its like a freshed squeezed bitter juice. Jeebus. The bitter dry hop is awesome. Im trying to figure out if this is bitter juice or juicy bitter. The balance is spectacular. I cant believe I havent had this yet. The mouth feel is a little heavy and creamy with a brighter carbonation and a lingering bitter juice for days. This is probably my favorite S&S from Hill Farmstead. Jesus.

Cloudy yellow gold with lasting thin foamy white head ; aroma is mild hop and grain balance; flava is citrusy hoppy notes of licorice grain and spice; feels medium to light crisp nice foamy fizz; finishes dry bitter

From the growler obtained at the brewery. Murky looking orange pale-yellow pour. Moderate white head. Fruity esters of cantaloupe. Other esters of citrus juice and a dim toasted malt presence. No booze for 8.3%. Medium to heavy body with a definite acidity. The taste is fruit and citrus forward with a potent bitter bite at the finish. Not a dry one but a juicy finish.
Sample @ Hill Farmstead Tap Takeover, Warpigs. Cloudy light amber body with a medium white head. Caramel, pine, hops, fruity, sweetness. Heavy bitter end.

CBC 2016 Green session. Hazy orange body with a big white head. Aroma of tangerine, citrus, tea, pine. Taste of pineapple, citrus, grapefruit, good bitterness, with a mild tickling sweetness. Dry crisp hoppy finish. Quite nice.

Tap @ CBC 16. Pours murky yellow with white head. Aroma is quite dank with slight grainy notes, citrus, lemon zest, orange and slight pine. The taste is dank, bitter, lots of citrus, orange, slight malts and peach. Good but far from the best hoppy HF.

Tap @ CBC2016. Pours hazy pale orange with a big white head. Aromas of malt, sweet orange, hops, grass, light earthy. Taste is sweet, bitter fresh hops, orange, citrus, mandarin. Not really hitting my sweet spot with this.

Draught @ [ Hill Farmsted Tape Take Over ] - Warpigs Brewpub, Flaesketorvet 24, DK-1711 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Hill Farmstead Society & Solitude #4 ].Murky matt - grey medium orange yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, sweet fruit, moderate yeasty, saison yeast - peppery hops. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, peppery hops - yeast, minerals, tropical fruit,maybe a bit green. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160512]

Draft @ Warpigs Brewpub, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy pale orange color with a small white head. Has a fruity citrus hoppy piney peachy aroma. Fruity malty piney peachy hoppy bitter grapefruit flavor. Has a fruity malty piney hoppy bitter grapefruit finish.

Draught @ CBC 2016, Green session, København
Pours hazy golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, grape, peach and pine needles. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long piney, grapefruit, peach and citrus finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Sample @ CBC16, Copenhagen. Green session. Cloudy golden pour with a frothy head. Notes of juicy hops, stone fruit, apricot, light grape fruit, light biscuits and some pine sap. Delicious!

Aroma of pine, citrus, grapefruit, tangerine, orange and mango. Taste is lesser than aroma, with a very green feel to it, pine, resinous with some mango/orange. Good mouthfeel, round and quite smooth. Pretty decent, but didnt feel fresh.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2017 Ra-rate 1/28/17: Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at the RateBeer award ceremony bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Cloudy yellow. Fruity hops, dry, moderately bitter, juicy. 7/3/8/3/16=3.7

[5/12/16] Draught at Warpigs in Copenhagen. Murky yellow. "Green" hops aroma, fruity and oniony. Flavor of juicy fruity hops, "green" and a bit oniony, with moderate bitterness. Quite light-bodied. 7/3/8/3/15=3.6

Draft. A hazy golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of lemons, spices, straw, hops, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of hops, spices, lemons, spices, and alcohol, leading to a bitter finish. Nice one.

I dont know, folks. I thought this was nice but not tremendous at the 4.0 level. I loved the hazy yellow appearance (with a moderate head), but as an Imperial IPA, I thought it was solid but fairly standard. The fruitiness of the citra is there; Im not as experienced with Galaxy. Interesting anyway. (on tap at Mikkeller and Friends, Copenhagen)

Keg @ WarPigs. Pours hazy tiny burnt yellow with a frothy white head that leaves some thick lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is grassy and tiny fruity with crackers, white bread, grapefruit juice, mango, freshly cut grass, pine needles, urinal cakes, minerals, lemon zest and hints of alcohol. Taste is tiny sweet, bitter, fruity and grassy. Mouthfeel is round, tiny dry, slightly astringent, tiny boozy and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with grapefruit, bright tropical fruits and bitter green grass hops. Off in the nose but taste is damn good.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Århus. Good piney hop aroma. Muddy orange color. Small white head. The flavour is caramelly, quite bitter, piney with a mild yeast not in the finish. Also just sweet enough to balance some of the bitterness.

fra fad
duft: citrus lime frisk appelsin 
smag: citrus lime appelsin humle juice appelsin

Sample at CBC 2016. 

Hazy orange with a white head. Hoppy with grapefruit, caramel, light mango, pine and some hay. The body was medium and the finish bitter.

Sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Hazy yellow shade with a big white head. Pithy, fruity, grassy hop aroma. Taste is big but smooth and endlessly drinkable. More grassy, fruity, black pepper flavours. Lovely stuff.
pour cloudy pale with a fine white head. aromas are really fruity, lot of exotic fruit, light spicy. taste medium bitter, with sweet notes. full bodied, but really refreshing, high drinkability!
On tap at CBC 2016 - day 2. Peaches, oranges, lemons, some pineapple, on top of a nice malty sweet blanket. An excellent IPA.

From tap at Warpigs, Copenhagen. Hazy yellow golden color with white head. Hoppy aroma, floral, grassy, weedy, light pine, citrusy fruity, orange, grapefruit, stone fruits. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Draught at WarPigs Brewpub, Hill Farmstead Day, kindly shared by KimJohansen. Pearl white head leaving lacing rings down the glass. Cloudy golden-orange body. Smooth aromas of peach and apricot. Fruity taste profile with moments of pineapple and peaches backed by grainy malt. Bittersweet hopped fruity ending, warmth from integrated alcohol. Fine bodied. Pleasant (Copenhagen 12.05.2016).

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Farmstead Day, Warpigs, Copenhagen (12/05/2016) - hazy golden coloured pour with white head. Aroma and taste is a medley of tropical and citrus fruits, hoppy and malty, some caramel, orange, grapefruit and peach, pine needles, light floral, hoppy bitter finish. Good stuff.

Tap @ Warpigs. Hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop, peach, citrus and tropical fruits. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, peach, tropical fruit, medium sweet, grapefruit, little pine and medium bitter

Draught @ Warpigs, Copenhagen. Pours hazy golden with creamy white head. Aroma of malt, grass, bitter fruity hops, peach, grapefruit, light cats piss. Flavor is malt, grass, rich fruity hops, peach, mango, grapefruit. Medium body, average carbonation, bitter finish. 120516

Sample at Warpigs during Hill Farmstead Day 2016. Hazy golden/orange beer with a nice offwhite head. Hoppy citrus and caramel aroma, pine, hay, some diacetyl. Hoppy citrus flavor, grapes, caramel, floral notes, some biscuits. A bit unclean.
Tap at CBC2016, Copenhagen. Colour is very cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, citrus, grape, hops and malts. Great.

Draught @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Hazy golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of fresh hops, tangerine citrus, grain and weed. Awesome Aroma. Taste is very light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of citrus, tangerine and light grain. Medium bodied with medium. Awesome.

Tap @ CBC -16. Hazy orange with a large fluffy white top. intense citrus, lime aroma blending into grapefruit and resin. taste is light bitter. more citrus flavors along with pine and resin. Quite nice. medium body and co2

14.05.2016, tap @ CBC:
Big creamy longlasting head, hazy. Aroma is fresh grassy, citrus peel, grapefruit, leafs, fresh hops, pine needles, lawn, moss, soda powder, winegum, dried fruits. Taste is slightly dry grassy, leafs, pine needles, wet grass, moss, hops, lawn, light malts, bark, minerals, dried grain, hints of saltwater. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry and harsh mouthfeel. Nice.

CBC 2016. Pours hazy orange with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of peach, mango, resin, kiwi. Taste is fruity with a robust malty backbone and floral hints. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. This is so fuck ingredients well balanced its ridiculous. Just fantastic!

Pours hazy pale amber with low white head. Aroma of mango, vanilla, peach, passion fruit. Taste is mild fruit sweet with light bitter finish, complex yet incredibly smooth. Body is light and creamy with soft carbonation.

Pours cloudy golden with low white head 
Aromas lovely hoppy of peach, apricot, mango, pine, resin 
Taste has lovely hoppy notes of peach, mango, citrusy fruits, resin, pine, caramel 
Utterly brilliant!
Tap at war pigs... Hazy Amber... Thin white lacing.. Juicy passion peach nose...soft sweet floral fruit.. Juicy long soft summer fruit.. Pepper finish
Tap @Warpigs. Hazy orange, offwhite head. Aroma has tropical fruit and caramel. Supersmooth caramel and grapefruit. Really nice.
Cloudy peach/orange coloured. Nice forest hops and some fruityness on the nose. Great fruity taste along the hoppiness.

On tap at Warpigs. Pours a cloudy murky Amber with full head. Aromas of muddled tropical fruit, citrus and wet malts with light floral notes. Flavors of dry pineapple, candied lemons, and pine. Bitter finish.

Tap @ Warpigs, tap take over. Murky golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 120516
Tap@ warpigs. Hazy golden, thick white head. Tropical fruity, apricotty, hoppy, juicy aroma. Slight caramel, tropical fruity hops. Quite massive. Slightly unbalanced.

Draught. Golden coloured. Hazy. Dense off white head. Aroma. Citrus, herbs, flowers, spice, tropical fruits. Flavour. Citrus, pine, flowers, trop fruits, caramel, spice, grape. Medium to full bodied. Ends flowery bitter. Delicious

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From tap. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is grassy and citrusy. Crisp hoppy. Smooth fruity. Mild grainy and slight yeasty. Crisp fruity and hoppy finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Orangy, hazy. Some pine dankness, good grapefruits, sturdy malts on nose. Med full bodied, well bittered, nice sweetness balance tho. Long finish, pknes, bit resinous. Again, excelent balance, highly drinkable despite the monster specs.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2016 On tap at Warpigs. Muddy golden with a lasting white head. Aroma like a bag of fresh hops with citrus and pine. Very sweet malty and hoppy flavour with citrus, grass and peach. Nice bitter finish.

Pours cloudy orange greyish. Aroma of juicy hops, Citra, tangerine, light bready malts, peachy, really juicyness. Taste is rather bitter, light residual sugar. Dry and bitter finish. Very east coast style alike.

Couleur orangée et liquide complètement opaque avec une belle mousse qui ne disparait jamais complètement. On croirait croquer dans une pêche mélangée avec un ananas. Cest très juteux et aromatique avec une amertume modérée mais qui persiste en fond de bouche. Les saveurs nous ramènent un souvenir des pina colada sirotés sur le bord de la piscine et nous rappellent que lété frappent à nos portes.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2016 Updated the rating of this one, this deserves way more than 4.3. 750ml growler bought today @Hill Farmstead. Aroma: awesome juicy tropical fruits, oranges, pineapples. App: hazy murky cant see through apricot / orange colour. Exactly how I like them. Taste and palate: thin to medium body, hyper juicy and a bit resinous, medium bitter finish. Overall: what a great surprise. I bought this one thinking I had it before but once I put my big nose in my glass I could tell I never had it. Way more fruity than usual HF ipas. Reminds me of Julius except more bitter and a tad less fruity. Really really good. That kind of beer I wish could be available in cans as I can see myself drinking this in the pool, mowing the lawn.

Cloudy orange with a pale head. Aroma is super fruity, orange juice, lychee, guava, hint of grape skins. Light-medium bodied, nice bitterness on the palate, floral finish. Taste is pink grapefruit, guava, grape skins, lychee. Nice

Cloudy straw, lasting head. 
Full body, intensely flavored, long palate. 
Bitter, off dry. 
Very hoppy, resiny, complex, delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

July 15, 2015. On tap at The Farmhouse Tap & Grill. 
Cloudy golden with a small white head sticking to the glass. Aroma is dank, grassy and lots of tropical fruits with pineapple, mango, melon, orange and grapefruit.Taste is light to medium sweet, juicy and fruity, soft bitter. Finish is soft medium bitter with some citrusy tart and bitter pith notes to it, dank, light piney and sweet juicy pineapple and mango. Medium bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation.

750 mL growler. Originally reviewed 8/10/2012.

Very hazy orange. Small white head. Light, but almost contiguous layer of foam remains atop the beer. Surprisingly leggy as I swirl it.
 A two-faced smell. First aroma is a gigantic pineapple and mango flavor. Almost like theres mango juice in it. Sweet smelling. Behind it is a distinct grapefruit pungency. Almost as if there are two glasses of beer in front of me and Im smelling both at the same time.

The flavor lacks a bit of the depth the aroma has. The flavors blend better, but they are also a touch diminished. The grapefruit is more dominant than the tropical fruits and the grapefruit becomes much more dominant in the finish. Builds to a strong bitter grapefruit finish.
 Low-ish carbonation. Probably due to the growler. Medium body. The bitterness is extreme, though, much like Society & Solitude #3. Like chewing on a grapefruit in the end.
 Delicious, even if abrasive in the finish.

Growler from HF. Pours a slightly hazy golden-orange with a three-finger white head. Leaving nice lace. Aroma is loaded with dank cannabis, mango, papaya, grapefruit rind, cat piss, pine needles, light malt sweetness and an herbal undertone. Taste is equally as stellar! Great harmony of tropical fruits and pine....gym sock stuffed with ganja....floral bouquet and some bitter grapefruit punch. Finishes moderately dry, lightly bitter. Juice in a glass. This is one of the better IPA/Imperial IPA that I have had from Hill Farmstead. So dank!

Growler in NH @ Leightons Stag. Pours hazy yellow orange, sizable white head. Smell is guava, OJ, tropical fruits, grass and fresh pine. Taste is major fuzzy fruit bomb, gooey citrus hops, pine, light sweet malt. Very lovely gooey, smooth mouthfeel. Great, hugely drinkable & balanced.

Growler filled 4 days ago. Pours a hazed light orange, large white head. Aromas of sweet clementines, cantaloupe, some citrus. Taste is semi sweet and only slightly bitter. Gentle waves of tropical fruit wash over your tongue with each sip. Melon, mango. Finish is almost godlike. I would drink this everyday for the rest of my life if I could.

Yeah baby! 750ml growler. Pours cloudy golden orange, medium creamy white head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is dank, citrus, tropical, armpits, guava. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, juicy, dank, hint of pot. Medium body, soft mouthfeel. Yum.
Pours a hazy straw orange with a white lacing. The aroma is pine and citrus, with notes of orange and pineapple. The flavor is bitter and the palate is rather juicy.

750ml growler pours cloudy opaque pale orange with 2 finger head. Nose is dank piney clementine, lineapple, mango, tropical and grassy. Taste is pithy orange, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, medium balanced bitterness, light cracker malt. Finishes dry, super fruity, tropical. Tasty!

Deux de mes meilleures 2ipa de HF réunis en un seul produit. Je nen demandais pas tant! Robe jaunâtre très trouble, epais col de mousse blanc moyennement dense, une dentelle mince et collante. Arômes de fruits tropicaux. Le Galaxy semble dominer son collègue. Pêche, tangerine, melon deau, cantaloup, mangue. Le citra se pointe en arrière-plan, plus sucré, un effet de punch aux agrumes. Le nez est superbe, cest doux, aucune trace dalcool, un peu de résineuse mais rien dintense. En bouche, encore un party exotique. Le citra prend plus de place ici. Beaucoup dagrumes: tangerine, orange, pamplemousse rose. Le Galaxy lui se colle au palais et apporte une sensation plus sucré de pêche et melon deau. La finale laisse place au côté plus amer des houblon mais toujours sur un fond dagrumes. Une agréable texture moyennement mince, un corps assez rond et une amertume juste à point, une carbonation un peu trop intense au début mais qui se stabilise par la suite. Se boit tout seule et le haut taux dalcool ne paraît pas. Une bière dangereuse!

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2016 Pours hazy glowing golden orange with thick white head. Smell is dank hops, juicy tropical fruit, grapefruit, and pine. Taste is piney hops, resin, tropical fruit and citrus. Super Juicy and silky mouthfeel. Light body and medium carb. Citrus Bomb.

Pour from growler obtained 7-10 from the source. Poured a nice glowing cloudy orange with medium bubbly white head. Aromas of tropical fruit and citrus stand out. Flavor had mango, peach, grapefruit, orange. Medium body and a thick texture. Good carbonation and very smooth finish. Easily drinkable for what the ABV is.

[ 2wk growler ][ 8oz ][ Tasting ][ ? ][ Tulip ][ 04.07.15 ]golden glowing hay, puffy white head lasts. Stinky dank nose, plenty of bright grapefruit and rind, tangerine and a little cement. Tons of bitter tangerine, oily up front with little egg sulfur and tea mid palate are only distractions, considerable pale malt with light caramel sweetness through grassy, earthy bitterness, moderate rind with reemergence of faint tangerine.

Location: Growler from the brewery, 7/9/15


Aroma: It is tropical hop dominated, grapefruit, mango, peach, some pine, and a little greenery

Appearance: Bright, almost glowing orange color, cloudy, with a lasting sheet of frothy white head

Flavor: Tastes fruity and a little sweet, with a nice, hoppy, mid-bitterness from mid-palate to finish

Palate: Has a smooth, softness that makes it so drinkable, finishes with a perfect dryness

Overall Impression: 
Enjoyed this more from the growler than I did when I only had the small sample at the brewery. We are talking a jump from great to really great here, so thats pretty impressive. Didnt love it quite as much as I did the Double Citra, but its pretty close. I keep giving these beers such high scores. Im making a point to not take the brewery name into account, but damn if the beers arent completely worthy of these scores. Excellent.  Way too drinkable for an 8% beer.  Drinks great.  What else is there to say?
UPDATED: JUL 17, 2015 Draft taster at the brewery. Fantastic! Floral, fruity, citrus, sweet malt, taste and aroma of soft grain. Maybe the best IPA that HF has.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2015 Draught at Armsby, 6/28/15Not quite as steadfast head is an off-white and tops a gold-copper body with medium-high clarity. Retention is still quite high.Straightorward citra in the nose show lemon, lemon oil, orange rind and soft grapefruit notes while the galaxy does its weird thing, though less so in combination with the citra, providing a hybrid stone fruit-tangerine thing and yet also a leafy, nearly spicy star fruit-like juiciness. A touch of dullness, maybe from yeast, maybe from hop and not quite the unendingly juicy/tropical sniffable-ness of some of the very best DIPAs (though still nothing to scoff at). Cracker and white bread provide backdrop, nicely dry and with very light suggestions of honey and wheat-like softness. No alcohol and shockingly hard to tell apart from their lower gravity pale ales.Starchy, sparse, bready malts are very, very dry and are heavily laced with bitterness, though the juiciness from both hops shows up quickly to quell any dissension. Tangerine, grapefruit, lime, cherryskin and unripe mango all join the party, very flavorfully, while little/no trace of resin or overly bitter hoppiness ever re-emerges. Heavily dextrnous/full-bodied mouthfeel is the only thing that tips off the drinker to the higher gravity, as alcohol, sweetness and heavy bitterness are nowhere to be found.

Dégustée sur la terrasse en ce premier jour de vacances avec Marco. Cheers buddy! Bière blonde et orangée. De forts parfums dorange, de mangue et dabricots émanent de cette bière. Les arômes sont fraîches et plutôt timides. Je mattendais à quelque chose de plus explosif. La bière affiche un col mousseux blanc maculé, comme tous les produits du même style de la Maison. Un mélange de fines et de grosses bulles. Entre la première et la dernière gorgée, la même question demeure sans réponse: sagit-il vraiment dune IIPA? Lalcool est invisible, une explosion de saveurs tropicales envahit ma bouche sans toutefois être exagérée. Tant la texture que les saveurs me font penser non pas au fruit lui-même, mais à la pelure du fruit; un mélange de pêche et de mangue. De longueur moyenne, cette bière est fraîche, légère et dangereuse!

Shared growler notes from Craft Ale House. Turbid straw pour with white head. Nose was hoppy, pineapple, mango, tangerine. Vermont/Maine IA flavor with spicy and yeasty hops, pineapple, papaya, mango notes, complex finish, juicy and fresh taste.

Pour is extremely cloudy pale orange with lots of tight white head that lingers. Nose has a husky grain, a musky hop, and tons of citrus. Extremely bright. Flavor follows suit, bright, tons of citrus in back, stronger grain presence, very musky citra hop, moderate bitterness, really soft feel with great carb. Bitterness lingers slightly through the finish.

Growler shared by a friend Right after abner. Filled 13 days ago and allready drinking it across the pond! Poured a cloudy light yellow colour with a white head. Citrussy, Peach, apricots, Some crisp malts, citrus, citra aroma coming trough. little spice hint, less pine and bitter as abner, hints of fresh cut grass, little spicy herbal hint at the end. Very refreshing taste. Pretty enjoyable.

Aroma: Garlic, Onions

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, Thick White Head, Great Lacing

Taste: Onions, Mild Garlic, Mild Citrus Rind

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying, Mildly Bitter

2l growler. Cloudy light yellow. Very heavy on the grapefruit, yet light. Kinda tastes like grapefruit juice pulp and water. Subtile and easy drinking. Pretty good, but one of my least favorite HF IPAs.

Growler, filled five days ago. Pours a beautiful pale yellow-gold, cloudy and luminous, with very small white head that fades to large-bubbled lacing. Aroma is musky and dank, with resinous and faintly vegetal hop notes mingling with sweet pineapple, orange sherbet, grapefruit juice, tangerine, mango, and papaya. Taste is once again quite pineapple-y but there is also sweet grapefruit and orange, mango, candied lemon, white grape, faint warming alcohol, and a piney/herbal but not overwhelmingly bitter finish. Body is somewhat oily but still light for the style. Very, very good.

Growler filled on Wednesday by Willrunforbeer, big thanks on this one. Bright gold color with thin lasting head retention in the snifter. Aroma is bright and pungent, grapefruit, grass, scallions, and mineral water. The flavor is just plain awesome. Great balance and a crisp dry finish. Top tier IPA.

Poured from growler thanks Willrunforbeer. Pours murky yellow gold with a thin white head. Aroma is juicy mango pineapple and pine. Taste is amazing. Tons of orange mango and citrus with a nice smooth hop finish. Wow!
Growler. Pours yellow gold white head. Nose and taste of green onion, citrus, lemongrass, grassy hop. Medium body.

Growler: Thanks, Jason. Super murky, bright sunshiny body; vibrant gold & orange. Soapy, eggshell tinted head on top; little bits of lacing left behind. Orange Creamsicle aroma, wet pine, a hint of tropical mango, faint white pepper, moderate dankness, candied citrus rind, a touch of freshly cut yard trimmings. With the first sip, the huge, juicy orange profile is what strikes first. Creamy orange flesh, nectarines, a pile of wet weeds, leafy bitterness, grass, herbal hemp oil... Mango & guava become apparent in the latter half. Nice transition from citric up front to almost more tropical in the finish. Juicy with a balanced bitterness. Malt? WHAT MALT? Another amazingly juicy, drinkable, delicious IPA from Shaun. I prefer S&S #5, but this is not far behind at all.
Bright citrus notes, pineapple, mango and floral hops. Thin mouthfeel, falls short of #5

from a 750ml growler filled at the brewery, it pours hazy yellow-orange with a thin head. the aroma is citrusv with a hint of pineapple, flavor is very bright, consistent with the smell and nicely balanced. mouthfeel is nicely carbonated and bittersweet with a crisp finish

Growler. Huge thanks to WillRunForBeer! Shared at Mikes. Pours a cloudy yellow-orange color with a small foamy head that fades slowly to a nice ring. Aroma jumps out of the glass. Juicy mango, melon, dank citrus, pineapple, and light pine. Tastes moderately sweet with just a hint of bitterness in the finish. Tons of tropical fruit juice, oranges, lemon, and mango. Very smooth to drink. Soft carbonation. A little oiliness in the mouthfeel. Awesome, smooth DIPA. If there was a bigger, bitter punch to this it would probably be up there with my favorites.

Courtesy of umich03jm
Growler: The aroma consists of big citrus, tropical fruits, lemon peel, grapefruit, and a hint of dank notes. It pours a cloudy dull yellowish-orange with a small soapy white head that quickly fades to a thin film outlined by a soapy ring. The flavor starts with heavy citrus/orange with tropical fruits. The finish light-moderate grapefruit and mango. Its light-medium bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel.

From notes. Taster at the source. Pours HF yellow with a white head
Aroma soft, slight dank, slight citrus. Tastes sweet and fruity orange, tangerine. Mild grass bitter finish.

Growler thanks to Seth. Pours a cloudy orange with thick frothy white head that lasts leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is strong grass, pine, and citrus. Medium mouthfeel with nice citrus and pine with light dry bitterness. Very good.

Growler pour. Fresh cut grass and ocean on the nose. Pours a cloudy gold. Nice flavor and a good back end. Really nice 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thank Keith!

Pours murky apricot orange with thick white foam that sticks around for quite some time. The nose really opens as it warms - peach, mango, dank, some pineapple and resin. Nice nose - not too sweet, which is norm as of late. Flavor is bitter and grainy with plenty of nuances. Pine, grapefruit rinds, some lemon and grains. Im surprised and refreshed at how bitter this is. Medium bodied and moderated carb. Nice beer, Im betting this is a step higher up at the brewery fresh as possible. I think the peach and mango would be stronger and really make this one.

Serving type: growler

08-14-2012

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2013 Definitely bitterer than previous S&S Ive had. $8 for the 8oz. pour at Positive Pie, the Montpelier location. From notes. To pint, it pours a darkish orange with a trim off-white ringed head barely a fingernail in length. Smells and tastes of beets, astringent hops, pineapple, candy cane sticks, beef bone marrow, peated malt, seaweed, and marsh rosemary dominate the forefront sensory. Heather, aloe, radishes, mint, tea leaves, and clay experienced by swallow. Really something here.

750ml growler into a HF wine glass. Huge thanks to Frank for this! Pours a super hazy golden amber body that almost hints towards being brown. Silky long lasting retention with a gorgeous layer of white foam. Looks perfect. S - Huge blast of citrus, pine, juicy tropical fruits, dank resin, and biscuits. Really nice aroma. T - Bitter grapefruit into mango and papaya juice. Ends with a biscuity cracker malt base and some pine and chalkiness. Mouth feel is creamy and rich with the abv becoming noticeable but not too deterring. O - A damn solid DIPA. Not as exciting as SS5 but this is just so well balanced and fresh tasting.

Growler @ Richards tasting. Hazy light orange pour with a white head. Fruity as hell. Peach, melon, mango, pineapple, and grapefruit. Big pine notes and a hint of pale malt. Flavor is juicy and fruity. Tons of mango, peach, pineapple, melon, grapefruit, and tangerine. Light bitterness, some pine, light malt, and dough.

From 750ml growler, thanks to Mac, 09/22/2013. Pours cloudy orange, head swirls on the surface, sticky lacing left around the glass. Aroma is bright orange essence, juicy, light grapefruit and touch of pine, fresh hop character. Taste follows suit: tangerine and grapefruit juice, caramel with bitter finish. Medium body, soft and creamy, smooth. Super tasty, definitely top tier.

Pours from a swingtop bottle a bright orange-gold color with a medium foamy ivory white head that dissipates slowly. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, citrus and malt. Medium-bodied with flavors of citrusy hops, grainy malt and mango. The finish is moderately bitter with a tropical fruit and hops aftertaste. Good beer all around.
Fresh growler. Grapefruit & juicy fruits like whoa. Citrus galore! Gorgeous pour, as always. Bitter on the back end without resinous linger. Plenty of malt backbone. Damn, this is fantastic.

Growler split with GT2. Beautiful, translucent mango juice pour. Thick, eggshell foam. Aroma is soft, floral, citrus, hay/farm. Taste is juicy, citrus hop bite, grapefruit bitterness and acid. Palate is the highlight- balanced, doughy, refreshing. Loved this one. Wow.

750mL flip-top thanks to DoctorB2B. Full haze, glowing peach pour. Medium white foam with delicate lacing. Fresh peach and butterscotch nose with mild salt, sweat, and thick melon sorbet. Taste is fresh and juicy with a pretty hefty white alcohol Gin bite. Long, herbal sage and white pepper finish. Alcohol is apparent, but the overall experience is juicy, fresh, and soft. Really nice as always. Amazingly quenching, soft palate that comes off as mango, white grapefruit sorbet. One of my favorite DIPAs ever.

Pours a cloudy yellow golden color with two fingers of the sticky eggshell foam. The nose is so inviting... big fruit notes of mango, pineapple, some citrus even a touch of fuji apple mixed with some earthy straw and pith. The palate follows and is so dialed in with balance between sweet, bitter and earthy, just wow from beginning to end this beer is a DIPA perfection.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2015 750ml growler poured into a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of citrusy and resinous and floral hops, some pale and caramel malts, and a little spiciness. Flavor the same with a great hoppiness. Smooth to average texture. Another really good beer from HF.  Edit: Why did I only give this a 4?

Awesome piney citrus, grapefruit, booze and some malt. Pours cloudy orange with great head and lacing. Strong bitter finish. Average carbonation. Awesome balance. Wonderful hops showcase here. Maybe it is something in the water out here. Tap at brewery.

Hazy light orange color, tinged with peach, thin white head. Bright burst of juicy mangoes, peaches, grapefruits, and oranges. Very mild sweetness that quickly gives way to dried orange peel bitterness. Smooth, crisp, and very soft texture. Lingering bitterness in the finish and virtually no alcohol presence.
An absolutely other-worldly beer from one of the best breweries on the planet. Unbelievable.

Draft at brewery. Hazy gold, foamy white head. Smells like an orange grove in springtime. Followed by a hop explosion in your mouth. Wow!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler smuggled back from VT by Alan, pours hazy golden orange, with light to medium head. Aromas of sweet malt, caramel, pineapple, and orange. Taste is most of the same, fruit punch, tangy citra, bitter galaxy. Excellent brew but it was better a year or so ago in philly. More sweetness now.
Swing top. Light golden pour with white head. Floral and herbal hop aromas dominate. Nice full hop flavors, but not too bitter, ert nice.

Pours a really hazy orange with a thin white head that leaves fair lacing. Aroma is heavenly with pine and tropical fruits (mangoes?). Taste is sweet but everything is in check with fruit flavors again (some might say mangoes again but I will say peaches). Palate is clean, carbonation on the higher side but it is appropriate really. Bitterness is high but never harsh. Some perfume notes. Awesome, really.

(750ml bottle) Pours a cloudy golden body with a medium white head. Aroma of mango, pineapple, passion fruit, orange, pine, and grapefruit. Flavor of grapefruit, grass, earth, caramel, and herbs with a moderately bitter finish.

Thanks to thirdeye11 for sharing this bottle. Hazy golden yellow with a white head. Aroma is grapefruit with a lot of orange and pine. Flavor is very similar. I get some bitter orange and tropical fruit notes from the hops, which meld together very well. There is also a little bit of grass as well as some biscuit malt. Medium bitterness. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Glad I got to try this one.

From August 2012. 750ml straight from the source. Pours an extremely opaque orange caramel color. Smells absolutely fantastic, but waht would you expect with galaxy and citra? Grapefruit, mango, pinapple, you name it. Tropical floral bomb. Taste follow with the tropical fruit parade, and a nice hoppy bitterness to round it out. 

This may be the best DIPA or beer in general I have ever had. Excited that they are rebrewing the series, just for this installment.

Growler back at Woodshop 7. Pours a hazy orange with nice white head with lots of lacing as you drink. Nose is loads of fresh spicy hops with a good citrus peel and grapefruit. Taste is overly bitter and not coming through fully for me. Some bland citrus in here, little sugar, and just not that much going on. One of the only disappointing HF hoppy beers.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text:
On tap at the Farmhouse, Burlington. Served in a tulip-y like glass.

Pours a glowing golden amber/orange with a thick, frothy white head. Ample lace and excellent retention. Intense fresh hop aroma on the nose of dank citrus and tropical fruits; orange, tangerine, mango and pineapple with some subtle grass. Flavor is stupidly hoppy like and instantly relatable to any other HF IPA. Flavor starts with a Double Citra resin and pulpy hop flavor mid palate and finish with a juicy and tropical fruit Double Galaxy sweetness. Same body as other HF IIPAs, medium thick, well carbonated and chewy. Does Double Citra plus Double Galaxy sound like a good idea to you? Yea.

On draft at Blackback pub in Waterbury. I also drank a 750 mL of this last week.

The beer appears hazy and golden hued with a half inch of white head. The aroma offers a delectable bouquet of citrus and hops. Malt presence seems minimal - seems very promising so far. OK Im back...just went to a different universe when I tasted this. To say this is delicious and smooth doesnt begin to do this beer justice. Light bodied without being thin. Dangerously drinkable. Will report back after I come back down from this...reviewed on 7-15-2012

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 07-15-2012 00:43:32  More by Huhzubendah
Draft offering at farmhouse tap..from notes..experimental ipa with galaxy and citra hops..fruity and barely any trace of the high abv..very enjoyable..amazingly fresh like other hf offerings..

In short: A fantastic aromatic and tasty fruity blond Double IPA that drinks way too easy
How: Fresh 750ml growler consumed the day of purchase
The look: Cloudy blond body topped by a small white head
In long: Nose is an explosion of all kinds of fruits, peaches, pineapples, grapefruits, passion fruits, more  Something about the interaction of Galaxy and Citra but I almost didnt any of the cat urine I usually get from Citra IPAs.  Taste has the Hill Farmstead IPA malt signature that Ive come to describe as soft fresh baguette with some pale crackers.  Theres a little sweetness sensation at first (candied dried fruits and sweet bananas) but quickly the hops take over.  Extremely tasty hops with a superb fresh fruitiness character.  Flavorful bitterness that is never too aggressive.  This 9% Double IPA is dangerously sessionnable.  Bitterness of medium intensity that sticks around for a long time blending with an after taste of tropicals fruits, bananas and why not a side of fruit salad.  Usual Hill Farmstead full bodied mouthfeel with plenty of very soft bubbles, very enjoyable to keep in the mouth.  All similar but all different, Hill Farmstead keeps pumping some of the best IPAs on the planet.  Anyway, I was all alone drinking a Hill Farmstead growler and eating buffalo chicken wings and my neighbour knocked on my door and asked me to keep it down when Im having sex.
bottle, thanks to thirdey11, golden orange color with nice white foam, orange citrus aromas with a funky floral blue cheese and citric flavor

On tap at the Black Back when I stopped here with Max on the way to Hill Farmsteads Harvest Festival.  No idea how I hadnt rated this one before, especially because I brought home a few growlers of it after the Saison fest, and drank a good bit of it there as well.  Alas.  Pours a hazed golden amber with a thin to medium sized white head.  Sweet floral hops, delicate citrus and melon.  Smooth, a touch of wheat.  Soft and tasty, warm yeast moves into a sweet mellow citrus note.  Long grapefruit, but delicate.  Lovely stuff.

bottle. bright golden, orange tint, with a very nice white head, good retention and lacing. sweet pine needles, leafiness and tropicalness, plenty of citrus, very nice pale malted body. average and soft carbonation, medium body - very oily, very nice lingering citrus-grapefruit finish. again, wow.

Growler sample via and shared with oakbluff. Hazy pale orange in colour with medium carbonation. Typical Citra + Galazy hop aromas (tropical fruits, tangerine, grass, gooseberry, etc...) dominate, with a hint of pale malt creeping in. Profoundly hoppy in the mouth as well, with notes of tangerine, quince, sweet grass, mango, and cotton candy. Fairly light bodied for the style, with a very strong and building bitterness. A bit on the rustic side, but in a good way.

750ml growler opened on September 4, 2012.  Im fearful for the day when a google search of "Society & Solitude" brings up Hill Farmstead beers instead of Emerson, but according to Greg Currie, literature cant give us insight into the mind and its workings anyways, so I drink Hill Farmstead when I could be reading Emerson.  

Pours a cloudy tangerine yellow-orange.  A finger of resilient, creamy white head sticks around.  

Riper-than-ripe juicyfruit nose.  Unbelievable tropical fruit, mango, tangerine, lemon citrus, pineapple, maybe a hint of green leafy bitterness.  Bright, bitter, and brilliant.

More of the same.  A citra bomb on the front of the palate, beaming citrus and pineapple, playing right into galaxys passionfruit/tropical fruit brilliance.  Mango juice.  This beer sweats more juicy, fruity bitterness than other beers are made of.  Resinous finish.  Just enough sweetness to pull this back from the too-bitter.  

Creamy; medium, medium light bodied.  

At this point Im convinced Shaun knows something other brewers dont.  One of my personal favorites from his repertoire of IPAs/DIPAs, and playing right into my weaknesses, S&S #4 is a nearly perfect showcase of what citra and galaxy can do.
Growler shared by Seth.  Cloudy yellow/orange pour with a white foamy head.  Citrus and nectarine aromas.  Piney hop notes.  A little unbalanced, but tasty....

Growler shared at Sanders place in NYC during an evening of heavy drinking. Pours a light, hazy gold with a strong, frothy white head. Dry orange citrus nose with some tangering and grapefruit secondarily, along with pine. Medium to big sweet flavor with loads of ripe citrus, juicy pine, some sweet bread. Full bodied with average, smooth carbonation. Juicy and sweet to finish with bunches of resinous pine, some sticky grass, ripe grapefruit and orange. Utterly drinkable. Great balance. Drinks just as smoothly as the lower ABV HF IPAs. Quite a feat.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2015 3800th rating. 750 ml swing-top growler from lushawn- thanks again, Shawn! Pours a hazy yellow-orange-gold color with a small white head. Aroma of wet leaves and grass, onion, citrus, sweet malts, and just a little pine. Flavor of citrus peel, sweet malts, floral notes, apricot, grass and herbs, and a little onion. Medium-bodied, with a bitter, surprisingly alcoholic mouthfeel and medium carbonation. A little too boozy and the hops didnt come together in this like they have in other HF double IPAs. Still solid. Re-Rate: I was wrong. Bumping up. Gorgeous mouthfeel.

Shared from a growler. Poured a light hazy golden-yellow color with a white head. Aroma was plenty of grapefruit, hops, with notes of sweet malts. Flavor was a nice tropical fruit hop mix with nice sweet malts. Very nice mouth feel, bitterness is balanced pretty well, plenty of nice hop character to it.

750mL growler, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks a lot, Dany!). Pours a cloudy golden / blond with a small white head. Aroma is heavenly, with loads of piney and citrusy hops, balanced by lots of biscuity malt. Flavour is very citric upfront, with the tropical fruits following revealing notes of passionfruit and mango, among others - the finish is again very citrus hop heavy and very bitter. Though not one of my favourites by them due to the slightly harsh astringency, yet another excellent IIPA from Hill Farmstead.

Growler... Cloudy golden ale with a small, creamy, white head. Good retention. The aroma is bursting-at-the-seams with an assortment of  citrus and tropical fruits - passion fruit really stands out. Medium-bodied with soft carbonation. The flavor leans way bitter, really showcasing those high alpha Citra hops. Lengthy, bitter finish as well. Growler courtesy of landhoney!

packs a wallop but lets you down gently. just poured myself the dregs of a growler...this baby looks like the beers that moe pours on the simpsons.  tastes like a nice pine forest but decently balanced for such a haughty flavorful IPA.

750mL Bottle. Catty, piney alcoholic raw greeness. The aroma does rise up and kiss me like HFs other Double IPAs. A nip of raw garlic and onion comes through. Theres a slight astringency and a slight dusty quality to the bitterness that shaves a few points off the top. Im also not getting into the hint of green onion that comes through. Feels drier and less bitter. The alcohol is really warm for the beer, somehow. Still very good, leaps and bounds above most Double IPAs, but in my opinion, not as good as the other HF Double IPAs Ive had.

grouuuwwwwler.   lugged all the fucken way back from vinnie testeverde knows where.   big potent bitter dank resin, spruce, and bright pine needles.  much more astringent than typical HF hoppy beers. also some bitter grapefruit.   wet hops.   dry mouthfeel.   clean.    def hop forward.    prefer a bit more balance.   leaves a dry resin pine note in the mouth.    good, but definitely preferred the society and solitude 1 and 3, which were more balanced.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 Enjoyed on tap at the Black Back Pub. A dirty blonde with a heavy dose of hops.A bit boozy in the finish.  Decent to try.Above average mouthfeel.
More hop aroma when had it from growler almost 4 years later.

Thanks to Deuane for grabbing me a growler of this one from the brewery.

A - Pours hazy golden orange with a dense two finger tall white head leaving sticky rings of lace down the entire glass.

S - Smells of fresh citric fruit zest, pungent hops, fresh cut grass, pine needles and some light caramel malt sweetness.

T - Starts off with a ton of hop bitterness that lasts through the finish. The galaxy and citra hops work well together but they are hard to tell them apart at times. Hints of citric fruit zest, grass and pine as well as some sweet caramel help round things out. The finish is quite bitter, lingering on the palate long after the finish.

M - Medium body with moderate carbonation. Lots of bitterness throughout with a dry finish, no alcohol detectable at all.

O - A very good DIPA yet again from Hill Farmstead. Not as good as some of their other hoppy beers but it was still a very enjoyable, easy drinking beer.

On tap at Three Penny Tap Room, Montpelier VT.  Golden, sunny aroma of kiwi, pineapple and mango with a certain earthiness to it thats darkly sweet, and pungent.  Theres a lot of the same stone-fruitiness in the flavor, imbued heavily with weed, green and fragrant and cloudy; malt is comfortably present, lightly flavored but tightly packed.  Alcohol lends a mild sheen to the palate which is rich, but still crisp; finishes smoothly, with a sticky, dandelion flavored bitterness.  A fine example of complicated simplicity; lowish alcohol, herbal/tropical hop combo, light but substantive malt.

On draft at Hill Farmstead Saison Festival in the retail shop, consumed as soon as it was filled. Beautiful cloudy amber-orange pour with a vivacious frothy white head. Nose and flavor really bring both of the blended beers out, with that beautiful biting lemon zest and grassy Citra character mixing with a more approachable, nectary Galaxy character, though big piney dankness comes through as well. Obscenely drinkable, as usual for Shaun, for a double IPA. Perfect crisp carbonation, but not so effervescent as to hide the complexity of the mix. Outstanding.
Tap from Farmhouse Tap. Pours straw with no head or lacing. Aromas of tangerine with some grass and lemon. Medium resin and pine bitter finish. Nice stuff.

On tap at Farmhouse Tap and Grill during Vermont Brewers Festival weekend. Cloudy light amber with white head. Marijuana, orange and grapefruit, light sourness, quite bitter, more malt and resin towards the end with some grass and fresh. Full body, moderate carbonation, nice bitterness that becomes sweeter on the finish, great balance.

Draught at Farm House Tap and Grill. Orange gold with a high, pillowy, fine head. Big fruit noce, mostly tropical, with peach, mango, grapefruit, grass, honey biscuits. Very biscuity, grainy flavor, ckae, big sweetness, tropical fruit salad, esters, bread, sweet orange. Soft, silky body. Wonderful.

(draught) cloudy medium to light gold, creamy white head that laces well. Nose of candied grapefruit peel, slight farmhouse funk, and light grass. Taste of grapefruit zest, lightly bitter but really well balanced, cream, funk, not as complex as some other Hill Farmstead beers.
On draft at Reservoir. Pours a cloudy grayish orange yellow straw gold with a medium sized white head. Aroma of fresh grapefruit, mango, pineapple honey and bitter hops. Taste is much the same.

Pours a hazy honey color with a medium white head.  Aroma is loaded with mango...touch of pine...great fruity/bitter balance.  Flavor follows suit...beautiful stonefruits.  Mouthfeel is medium and silky with a bitter dry grapefruity/mango finish.

A hazed golden ale with a thin white head. In aroma, a beautiful citrusy hops, piney and grassy, complex. In mouth, a smooth grassy caramel with citrusy hops, herbaceous and smooth, well done. On tap at Somerville Summerfest, July 14, 2012.

Like all of Hill Farmsteads beers, fantastic. They were running low when we were there and could only buy Society & Solitude #4 in 750 ml bottles. The place was packed.

hay, cereal,

Huge thanks to Mike for sharing this growler.  Pours cloudy golden amber hue with marshmellow off white head.  Aroma has a nice mix of citrus bitter hops with a touch of pine.  Medium mouthfeel.  Flavor has upfront citrus tart note, then the finish has a strong and somewhat astringent hop bite.  It lets you know that its a double.  Even though it doesnt really taste like a double.  Its very deceiving.  Thanks again Mike.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2012 Huge thanks to yourefragile for sharing this one.  Served in Hill Farmstead stemware.  Pours a moderate peach color with a nice white head and some spotty lacing.  Nose has heavy citrus and tropical notes. Mango big in the flavor, followed by heavy bitterness. Touch of passion fruit. Really bitter, but still crushable.  I would have liked a little less on that for more focus on the flavor blend of Citra and Galaxy.

pours a cloudy golden brown color with a off white dense head that dissipates quickly. smells of ripe tropical fruits, guava, over-ripe pineapple and citrus, light malty presence. taste is lots of tropical fruit- hop flavor and mild malt. dry and bitter, no alcohol to smell/ taste/ feel.

Swing top growler to pint (thanks mikem409).  Looks good; orange with off-white head.  Smells good too; grassy and citrus.  Tastes solid, but VERY grassy.  Average on the palate.  Good, but I wish the hops were a little more balanced.
Swing top thanks Ernesto. Pours orange with frothy white top. Smells super sexy citrus and grass. Taste super fresh and flora

Pour from a growler thanks to dan at Woodshop who brought this back three days prior to the tasting. Color was golden orange with a very white head. The aroma was not over powering but nice nonetheless with some lemon and grapefruit. Medium and rich on your palate. Flavors were excellent with some pineapple, peach alongside an earthy grassy quality. Cool combo of the two hop characteristics. Finish of course long, dry without being harsh or overly bitter or palate killing. Good beer.

750ml Growler drank the same day and 1 week later. The fresh growler was more fruity and had more carbonation. I didnt notice any major differences. Appearance: Deep opaque orange with thick white head. Aroma: Tropical fruits (orange, pinneaples) at first, then there is a rustic touch, wood, dank and grass. Taste: Very bitter, some spicy hops, a nice citrus tartness cuts through the bitterness and accentuates drinkability. Full bodied and very dry. Nice mix between rustic and fruity, quite complex. An average Hill Farmstead double IPA, awesome nonetheless.

Acquired in a trade. Big thanks to Adam for this one. Growler at home with my dad. Poured a hazy, golden orange with a frothy off-white head. Smells of flowers, grapefruit peel, tropical fruits, grass, and pine. Taste is big tropical fruits, tangerine, sweet oranges, grapefruit, mango, grass, and weed. Medium mouthfel with medium carbonation. Very well-balanced and a treat to drink I am looking forward to trying more HF beers.

Growler into tulip.  Very hazy gold.  Small white head that recedes quickly.  Aroma is pine, grass, little floral, little tropical, a little citrus and a dash of malt.  Flavor is pine, resin, citrus zest (somewhat pithy) mixed tropical fruit and the malt is just there to add to the complexity. Good bitterness. Super drinkable.  This is a top notch IIPA, however it is also my least favorite from Hillfarmstead.  I really love how some of Hillfarmsteads worst IPA/IIPAs are still the best that money can buy!

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2013 From growler.
Pours hazy blond with low white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of citrus, pine, resinous. Taste is of citrus, pine, resinous, malt. Overall: Ligth, resinous/pine finish. Very good. [8/4/8/2/15] [Updating this one: A strong bitterness in the taste, and some malt sweetness. Bitterness is a bit harsh in the finish.]
Draft at blind tiger. Pours a deep orange body with white lacing. Aroma is fresh floral, pine and citrus hops. Mouthfeel is dry with notes of bitter grapefruit, lemon, pine, and floral hops.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2016 Growler thanks to Kevin! Pours a near clear orange gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has an outstanding combination of slightly sweet citrus with slightly bitter pine backed by grass and just a hint of grain. Flavor has citrus up front that transitions to grapefruit and pine with a hint of onion backed by light grain.
Pours hazy amber. Aroma and flavour : citra hops, citrus, resinous, pine, slight malt. Really good beer, as (it sems) like all the other Hill Farmsted products!

Hazy apricot colored pour with a mountainous white frothy head. Huge citrus and stone fruits in the nose combine with earthy dankness and resinous citrus rind. Apricot, mandarin, orange, peach, and a hint of scallion come through in the flavor, finishing with sappy dankness. A great blending of two great hop profiles make this beer very interesting after trying the constitutive base beers. Easily as tasty as either of the aforementioned brews. Great body with pillowy effervescence and a dry sappy finish. Loved it!

Growler (750 ml) brought back earlier in the day from Hill Farmstead. Hazy pale orange with a small head and some lacing. Aroma of tropical fruits (citra?) and pine. Theres also some bubblegum and malt notes. Taste of tropical fruits and pine. Sticky bitterness. Medium body. A very good DIPA!

Another great DIPA here.  Aroma was slightly strange and off putting at first but I kind of got used to it.  Hits you with tropical fruits, pine, dank, onion, garlic.  Taste however is very nice and very tropical fruity with a nice sweetness that is welcomed in such a hoppy bitter beer.  Great work again.
Growler filled today, similar to ss3. Huge sticky flavors. Tons of tropical and citrus flavors

Enjoyed by the river in a Duvel Tulip at room temp from a growler filled yesterday at HFS brewery!

A - 3-finger solid white head that barely fades! Gorgeous cloudy bright orange that looks really nice!

S - Citra hops dominate with grapefruit and citrus characteristics. Galaxy sticks to the back of my throat and sticks around for a while. 

T - Really nice! Excellent fruity tropical characteristics. Pine, pineapple, mangos and oranges. finishing bitterness that sticks to my tongue like glue

M - 100% carbonation on mouth swish. Medium body. 

O - Another great beer! my two favorite hops in a glass. It tastes wonderful. I miss Society #2 but this is still a fantastic beer and one worth picking up! Drink it as fresh as possible for sure!
